docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
⛩ Heta Python library for works with hikka mods heta ⬇️ Installation 
pip install heta

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
• Channel
  • Chat
  • Developer

docs.title: Function decode_hash()
docs.text: This function is decoding heta module hash.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• mhash (string): The hash to decode.
  • app_name (string, optional): The application name used in the request header. Defaults to "Heta lib"

docs.title: Return Value
docs.text: Dictionary: The result of hash decoding in JSON format.

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
import heta

result = heta.decode_hash("207db6467c7ddd9b")
print(result)

# Output:

# {'link': 'https://heta.hikariatama.ru/Codwizer/ReModules/VirusTotal.py', 'name': 'VirusTotal'}

docs.title: Class module
docs.text: This class provides methods for working with modules.

docs.title: Method get_link()
docs.text: The method receives a link to the specified module.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• author (string): The author's name of the module.
  • project_name (string): The name of the repository containing the module.
  • module_name (string): The name of the module.

docs.title: Return Value
docs.text: String: Link to the module.

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
import heta

print(heta.get_link("Codwizer", "remodules", "virustotal"))

# Output:

# https://heta.hikariatama.ru/Codwizer/remodules/virustotal.py

docs.title: Method get_code()
docs.text: The method receives code of the module from module link.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • mlink (string): Link to the module.

docs.title: Return Value
docs.text: String: Code of the module.

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
import heta

print(heta.module.get_code("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FajoX1/FAmods/main/wakatime.py"))

docs.title: Class Repo
docs.text: This class provides methods for working with a hikka mods repository.

docs.title: Method get_modules()
docs.text: The method is receives all modules from repository.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • repo (string): URL of the repository.

docs.title: Return Value
docs.text: List of dictionaries: List of modules in the format [{"name": "name_mod"}, {"name": "name_mod2"}]

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
import heta

modules_list = heta.repo.get_modules("https://github.com/FajoX1/FAmods")
print(modules_list)

# Output:

# [{'name': 'wakatime'}, {'name': 'CodeBase64'}, {'name': 'stats'}, {'name': 'faker'}, {'name': 'edmes'}, {'name': 'fun'}, {'name': 'fabrika'}, {'name': 'tonscan'}, {'name': 'telegrapher'}, {'name': 'timer'}, {'name': 'tondns'}, {'name': 'gsearch'}, {'name': 'infoip'}, {'name': 'removebg'}]

docs.title: Function search()
docs.text: This function is searching module in heta

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• query (string): The search query.
  • limit (int, optional): The number of search results. Defaults to 1.
  • app_name (string, optional): The application name used in the request header. Defaults to "Heta lib"

docs.title: Return Value
docs.text: Dictionary: The search result in JSON format.

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
import heta

for mod in heta.search("carbon", limit=10):
  print(mod['module']['name'])

# Output:

# carbon
# Carbon
# catboy
# Iris
# corona
# RndNsfw
# cartoonimg
# craiyon
# cdeanon
# Craiyon
